intro: Ervatamia membranifolia, commonly known as the membranous leaf ervatamia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small shrub characterized by its narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
